name: Ban Tai Tote - Limited Edition - Sold Out
description:
Part of the Native Design Collection, which is inspired by exotic locations both near and far, from the jungle to the desert and to your own backyard, the Limited Edition Ban Tai Tote bears an original printed pattern named after its exact location, Ban Tai, Thailand. This delicate pattern of palm leaves – remaining true to its native place and moment in time.

Hand-stitched from soft, durable, and wrinkle-resistant microfiber, the bag has a zipper bottom (see additional image) that expands, giving the bag an additional 4 inches for extra room. Easy to roll up, water-resistant, and washable, you can take it with you wherever you go.

Handstiched out of fine soft microfiber, with a durability and wrinkle-resistant nature, these bags have a unique zipper bottom that expands out when needing extra room, whether filling it up on the city streets or on a journey through hillsides collecting rocks. Easy to roll up, water-resistant and washable, you can take them with you wherever you go.

expandable...see it here

17" x 15" zipped
17" x 19" unzipped
Soft durable fine microfiber fabric
Water and wrinkle resistant
100% machine washable
Made in the USA.

name: Bryce Tote - Limited Edition - Sold Out
description:
"With only the sound of my feet, the sun on my face, the wind at my back – a wander in the bright orange canyonland of Bryce, Utah, to find in the underbrush a beautiful wood pattern – a texture so recognizable, so simple, yet so complex."

The Native Tote Collection travels to far reaches of the globe, from the jungle to the desert, and to your own backyard. Each one of a kind printed pattern, named after their exact location, represent a small sacred corner of the world, revealed in its own native shape – shapes remaining true to their form, time and and sweet little spot on the map.

Handstiched out of fine soft microfiber, with a durability and wrinkle-resistant nature, these bags have a unique zipper bottom that expands out when needing extra room, whether filling it up on the city streets or on a journey through hillsides collecting rocks. Easy to roll up, water-resistant and washable, you can take them with you wherever you go.
